Specifies the relative path to the XML file that contains a valid company name(s) and license key(s).
Use "~/" (tilde) as a substitution of the web-application root directory.

example.code: <rad[C]:Rad[Control] LicenseFile="~/LicenseFile.xml" ... /> Sample LicenseFile: <root> <license company="ENTER_YOUR_COMPANY_1" licenseKey="ENTER_YOUR_LICENSE_KEY_1" control="[control]" /> <license company="ENTER_YOUR_COMPANY_2" licenseKey="ENTER_YOUR_LICENSE_KEY_2" control="[control]" /> </root>

summary.para: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represents the root nodes in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: Use the Nodes property to get a RadTreeNodeCollection object that contains all the root nodes in the tree. This collection is commonly used to quickly iterate through all the root nodes, or to access a specific root node in the tree.

Note:
A typical tree structure has only one root node; however, you can add multiple root nodes to the TreeView control.

The Nodes property can also be used to manage the root nodes in the tree programmatically. You can add, insert, remove, and retrieve RadTreeNode objects from the collection. Any updates to the collection are automatically reflected in the RadTreeView control after the next round trip to the server.
To access the child nodes of a root node, use the Nodes property of the node. Use the ChildNodes property of each subsequent parent-level node to navigate down the node levels.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represent the nodes in the control that display a selected check box.
member.returns: An ArrayList collection of the checked nodes.

remarks.para: When check boxes are displayed in the RadTreeView control (by setting the CheckBoxes property to true), use the CheckedNodes property to determine which nodes display a selected check box. This collection is commonly used to iterate through all the nodes that have a selected check box in the tree.

If the AutoPostBackOnCheck property of the tree is set to true, the NodeCheck event is raised when the check boxes of the RadTreeView control change state between posts to the server. This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine, such as updating a database or the displayed content, whenever this event occurs.

Note:
The CheckedNodes collection is populated using a depth-first traversal of the tree structure: each parent node is processed down to its child nodes before the next parent node is populated.

example.code: Protected Sub ShowCheckedNodes(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Dim message As String = String.Empty Dim nodeCollection As ArrayList = RadTree1.CheckedNodes Dim node As RadTreeNode For Each node In nodeCollection message += node.FullPath Next node nodes.Text = message End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represent the nodes in the control that are currently selected.
member.returns: An ArrayList collection of the selected nodes.

remarks.para: This collection is commonly used to iterate through all the nodes that have been selected in the tree.

If the AutoPostBack property is set to true, the NodeClick event is raised when end-users select a node in the RadTreeView control. This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine, such as updating a database or the displayed content, whenever this event occurs.

Note:
The SelectedNodes collection is populated using a depth-first traversal of the tree structure: each parent node is processed down to its child nodes before the next parent node is populated.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SelectedNode
member.summary: Gets a RadTreeNode object that represents the selected node in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: The text of a node in the RadTreeView control can be in one of three modes: default (none), selection (postback) mode and navigation mode. To put a node into navigation mode, set the Href property for the node to a value other than an empty string (""). To put a node into selection mode, set the AutoPostBack of the treeview to true (sets postback mode for all tree nodes) or set the PostBack property of any node to true.
When a node is in selection mode, the user can select a node by clicking on the text in the node. Use the SelectedNode property to determine which node is selected in the TreeView control.

Note:
A node cannot be selected when the TreeView control displays hyperlinks. When hyperlinks are displayed, the SelectedNode property always returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

When the user selects a different node in the RadTreeView control by clicking the text in the new node, the NodeClick event is raised, by default. If you set the MultipleSelect property of the treeview to true, end-users can select multiple nodes by holding the Ctrl / Shift keys while selecting.

example.code:
<radT:RadTreeView ID="RadTree1" runat="server" AutoPostBack="True" OnNodeClick="NodeClick" />
Protected Sub NodeClick(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal NodeEventArgs As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) info.Text = String.Empty Dim NodeClicked As RadTreeNode = NodeEventArgs.NodeClicked info.Text = NodeClicked.Text End Sub

<radT:RadTreeView
                ID="RadTree1"
                runat="server"
                AutoPostBack="True"
                OnNodeClick="NodeClick"
            />
             
            protected void NodeClick(object sender, RadTreeNodeEventArgs NodeEventArgs)
            {
                info.Text = string.Empty;
                RadTreeNode NodeClicked = NodeEventArgs.NodeClicked;
                info.Text = NodeClicked.Text;
            }

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the RadTreeView control has no nodes.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.IsCallBack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the page request is the result of a TreeView callback.

example.code: If Not Page.IsPostBack AndAlso RadTreeView1.IsCallBack 'your init code here End If

member.remarks: IsCallBack can be used to skip heavy initialization code. On TreeView callback, Page.IsPostBack is false and code inside If Not Page.IsPostBack block gets executed too. You can skip that by adding the RadTreeView.IsCallBack check.

summary.para: Gets or sets the object from which the data-bound control retrieves its list of data items.

remarks.para: DataTextField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Text property.

DataValueField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Value property.
DataBind() - (mandatory) menthod. Call this method after you've set the aforementioned properties per your scenario.

example.code:
Dim dbCon As New OleDbConnection("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=" + Server.MapPath("~/TreeView/Data/Tree.mdb")) dbCon.Open()
Dim adapter As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Links", dbCon) Dim ds As New DataSet() adapter.Fill(ds)
RadTree1.DataTextField = "TextColumn" RadTree1.DataValueField = "ValueColumn" RadTree1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadTree1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID"
RadTree1.DataSource = ds RadTree1.DataBind()

remarks.para: DataTextField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Text property.

DataValueField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Value property.
DataBind() - (mandatory) menthod. Call this method after you've set the aforementioned properties per your scenario.

summary.para: Gets or sets the specific data member in a multimember data source to bind to a data listing control.

example.code:

Dim adapter As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Links", dbCon) Dim ds As New DataSet() adapter.Fill(ds)
RadTree1.DataTextField = "TextColumn" RadTree1.DataValueField = "ValueColumn" RadTree1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadTree1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID"
RadTree1.DataSource = ds RadTree1.DataBind()

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LoadingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the loading message that is displayed when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.
member.remarks: This property can be used for localization purposes (e.g. "Loading..." in different languages).

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessage" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LoadingMessageCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Css class name that is applied to the loading message when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessage" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LoadingMessagePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the loading message when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessage" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.Sort
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order of the tree nodes in RadTreeView.

remarks.para:
RadTreeView supports node sorting. The only thing you need to do is to set the Sort property of RadTreeView to one of the following values:
- Ascending
- Descending
- None
Please, take into account that the treeview sorts the nodes just prior to content rendering on screen, not upon node adding / removing from the collection.

example.code: Protected Sub SortOrderChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case SortOrder.SelectedItem.Value Case "Ascending" RadTree1.Sort = RadTreeViewSort.Ascending Case "Descending" RadTree1.Sort = RadTreeViewSort.Descending Case Else RadTree1.Sort = RadTreeViewSort.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AllowNodeEditing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the text of the tree nodes are editable in the browser.

remarks.para: End-users can edit the text of tree-nodes by pressing F2 when the node is selected or by clicking on a node that is already selected (slow double click).
You can disable / enable node editing for specific tree nodes by setting the EditEnabled property of the specific RadTreeNode.

After node editing, RadTreeView fires the NodeEdit event and you can change the text of the node - the RadTreeNode instance is contained in the NodeEdited property of the event arguments and the new text is in the NewText property of the event arguments.

example.code:
<radT:RadTreeView ID="RadTree1" Runat="server" AllowNodeEditing="True" OnNodeEdit="HandleNodeEdit" />
Protected Sub HandleNodeEdit(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal NodeEvents As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) Dim nodeEdited As RadTreeNode = NodeEvents.NodeEdited Dim newText As String = NodeEvents.NewText
nodeEdited.Text = newText End Sub

<radT:RadTreeView
                ID="RadTree1"
                Runat="server"
                AllowNodeEditing="True"
                OnNodeEdit="HandleNodeEdit"
            />
             
            protected void HandleNodeEdit(object sender, RadTreeNodeEventArgs NodeEvents)
            {            
                RadTreeNode nodeEdited = NodeEvents.NodeEdited;
                string newText = NodeEvents.NewText;
             
                nodeEdited.Text = newText;
            }

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ExpandDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the value controlling the duration of the expand animation effect on collapse / expand.
member.remarks: The default value is 2. Set the property to 0 to disable the animation effect on expand / collapse.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ShowLineImages

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SingleExpandPath
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether only the current branch of the treeview is expanded.
member.remarks: The property closes all nodes that are not parents of the last expanded node. This property is only effective on the client browser - in postback modes you need to handle the logic yourself.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LicenseFile
member.summary:
Specifies the relative path to the XML file that contains valid company name(s) and license key(s).
Use "~/" (tilde) as a substitution of the web-application root directory.

example.code:
<radE:RadEditor LicenseFile="~/LicenseFile.xml" ... /> Sample LicenseFile: <root> <license company="ENTER_YOUR_COMPANY_1" licenseKey="ENTER_YOUR_LICENSE_KEY_1" /> <license company="ENTER_YOUR_COMPANY_2" licenseKey="ENTER_YOUR_LICENSE_KEY_2" control="editor" /> </root>
Note: If you do not specify the "control" attribute it will be set to "editor" by default.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AfterClientFocus

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ValidationGroup

para.font: Note: This property is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.PostBackUrl

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip is clicked.

member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip control is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.RadTreeViewEventHandler
member.summary: The delegate defining all RadTreeView Events.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.Design.RadTreeViewEditor
member.summary: The editor for the RadTreeView items.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.Design.RadTreeViewEditorForm
member.summary: The Windows form that hosts the RadTreeView editor.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode
member.summary: This enumeration controls the expand behaviour of the nodes.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode.ClientSide
member.summary: The default behaviour - all nodes are loaded in the intial request and expand is performed on the client, without server interaction

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode.ServerSide
member.summary: Forces firing of the NodeExpand event - a postback occurs and developers can populate the node with its children in server side event handler

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode.ServerSideCallBack
member.summary: Forces firing of the NodeExpand event asyncronously from the client without postback - the NodeExpand event fires and child nodes added to the node collection are automatically transferred to the client without postback.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition
member.summary: Specifies where the loading message is shown when Client-side load on demand is used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText
member.summary: If the node text is "Some Text", the text is changed to "(loading ...) Some Text" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText
member.summary: If the node text is "Some Text", the text is changed to "Some Text (loading ...)" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText
member.summary: The text is not changed and (loading ...)" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.None
member.summary: No loading text is displayed at all.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort
member.summary: The Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort enumeration supports three values - None, Ascending, Descending. Default is None.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort.None
member.summary: Nodes are not sorted at all.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort.Ascending
member.summary: Nodes are sorted in ascending order (min to max)

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort.Descending
member.summary: Nodes are sorted in descending order (max to min)

member.summary: Utility class for Design - Time VisualStudio.NET project management.

member.summary: Defines the common property categories' names

member.summary: Summary description for ContextMenu.

member.summary: Collection containing all items (of type ContextMenuItem) for the particular ContextMenu instance

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenu.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenu.Name
member.summary: The name of the ContextMenu - this uniquely identifies the menu and you can assign ContextMenus to different tree nodes by setting the ContextMenuName property of the node to the name of the ContextMenu.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenu.Width
member.summary: You can explicitly set width for the ContextMenu.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenuItem
member.summary: Summary description for RadTreeNodeContextMenuItem.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenuItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The text of the Context Menu item.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenuItem.Text
member.summary: Text of the item. The value of Text is displayed in the browser.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenuItem.Image
member.summary: Left-side image if you want images in your context menu.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenuItem.PostBack
member.summary: If set to true, fire a postback, firing the ContextMenuItemClick event. If false (default) no postback will occur.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewContextMenu.ContextMenuItem.ID
member.summary: ID of the value - this might be helpful in some scenarios, for example multi-lingual context menus, where the item cannot be uniquely identified by its name.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode
member.summary: Public API class with properties and methods for working with treenodes at runtime.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode._Nodes
member.summary: Contains a collection of child treenodes. If the collection is empty (Node.Count == 0), there are no child nodes.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.TreeViewParent
member.summary: Instance of the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Instantiates a new instance of RadTreeNode.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Instantiates a new instance of RadTreeNode.
member.param: The value of the Text attribute of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor. Instantiates a new instance of RadTreeNode.
member.param: The value of the Text attribute of the node.
The value of the Value attribute of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.AddNode(Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode)
member.summary: Adds a child RadTreeNode to the Nodes collection of the current instance.
member.param: The instance of the node to add.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares TreeNodes nodes on their Text property

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles Expand/Collapse state of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ExpandChildNodes
member.summary: Expands all child nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ExpandParentNodes
member.summary: Expands all parent nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CollapseChildNodes
member.summary: Collapses recursively all child nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CollapseParentNodes
member.summary: Expands all parent nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Remove
member.summary: Deltes the node from the current treeview hierarchy.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Parent
member.summary: The parent RadTreeNode. Null if there's no parent (root node).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CssClass
member.summary: Custom CSS class applied only on the current node. Overrides NodeCssClass from the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CssClassOver
member.summary: Custom CSS class applied only on the current node when the mouse hovers the node. Overrides NodeCssClassOver from the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CssClassSelect
member.summary: Custom CSS class applied only on the current node. Overrides NodeCssClassSelect from the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Text
member.summary: The text the the node displays on screen.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Value
member.summary: Can be used to store information that is available both on client and server side.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Category
member.summary: Can be used to distinguish between different categories of nodes. For example some nodes may belong to category "Country", others to "Continent", etc. Using the property makes it easier to find which category the current node belongs to on both client and server side.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ToolTip
member.summary: Displays a hint popup information when the user points the node with the mouse. If WindowsXP Narrator is turned on, it will read the text on the tooltip which is an importat requirement of Section 508 (government requirement for building software that can be used by people with disabilities)

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Image
member.summary: Optional image that is displayed before the text of the node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ImageExpanded
member.summary: Optional. Should be used only when is specified. The image displayed when the node is expanded.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ClientID
member.summary: The ClientID of the node which gets sent to the browser. Read-only (autogenerated by r.a.d.treeview)

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Level
member.summary: The Level of the node in the treeview hierarchy. Root nodes have Level = 0.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Href
member.summary: The URL the user is redirected to when he/she clicks on the node. Remember to add "http://" in front of links that lead outside your website.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Target
member.summary: Specifies the name of the target frame for Href redirection. Supports "blank" for opening the specified Href in a new window.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.PostBack
member.summary: Specifies if the node should generate a server (postback) event upon mouse-click. Overrides the AutoPostBack property of the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Expanded
member.summary: Sets the expanded/collapsed state of a tree-node that contains child nodes.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Enabled
member.summary: Sets enabled/disabled state for the node. Disabled nodes are rendered with a different CSS style and can not fire events.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Visible
member.summary: If visible is set to false, the node and its child nodes will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Checked
member.summary: If checkbox mode is turned on, this property shows whether the node is checked or not.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Checkable
member.summary: If the parent RadTreeView has its CheckBoxes property set to true, RadTreeView automatically displays a checkbox next to each node. You can set this property to false for nodes that do not need to display a checkbox.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Selected
member.summary: If the current node is selected. By default, only one node can be selected, however you can enable multiple node selection by setting the MultipleSelect attribute of the parent RadTreeView to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.DragEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disabled the ability to drag this node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.DropEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disabled the ability to drop nodes over this node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.EditEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disabled the ability to edit a node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ContextMenuName
member.summary: The context menu name that will be opened when end-users right-click the node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ExpandMode
member.summary: When set the ExpandMode.ServerSide will fire a server event (NodeExpand) so you can populate the node on demand.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.LongDesc
member.summary: A Section 508 element - applied

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Prev
member.summary: Gets the previous node sibling in the tree structure or returns null if this is the first node in the respective node group.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Next
member.summary: Gets the next node sibling in the tree structure or returns null if this is the last node in the respective node group.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Index
member.summary: Returns the index of the node in the current tree branch.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.FullPath
member.summary: Returns the full path (location) of the node delimited with slashes. For example if the current node has a Text attribute "Houston", its parent node has a Text attribute "Texas" and its parent (root) node has a Text attribute "U.S.A", FullPath will return "U.S.A/Texas/Houston"

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ParentNodeCollection
member.summary: The node collection of the parent (node or treeview for root nodes).
